summary: A driven and creative sales leader with considerable international experience building markets and managing teams across Continental Europe and Africa. My key to sales success is an analytical and data-driven focus, combined with a hands-on approach to coaching and mentoring. Primary sectors include the publishing industry; Tertiary Education and Research sectors; as well as corporate learning; and retail.

profile_positions.description:
Reporting into the VP Sales EMEA, I lead the Sales Operations group, supporting all sales activities across the UK, Europe, DACH, Middle East & Africa. Reporting into the group are the sales support executives as well as Marketing.

My mission is to enhance the effectiveness of sales and enhance productivity. With a data-driven and analytical approach, we empower regional leaders and Account Managers with the tools and information required to deploy effective go-to-market activities.

Core responsibilities include:
•	Sales data – building and communicating reports and dashboards to enable timely high-level as well as detailed analysis of performance against plan
•	Developing go-to-market models and strategies
•	Organizing and maintaining sales collateral for access by Account Managers 
•	Sales forecasting at a group, region, and individual level – combining pipeline activity with real-time sales data
•	Building, managing, and communicating Account Manager compensation plans and incentives
•	Working with regional leaders to define sales territories
•	Managing systems and IT tools and platforms, including CRM
•	Handling lead generation and development of prospects
•	Training sales members in products and solutions
•	Supporting the hiring, onboarding, and mentoring of sales team members
•	Defining and refining sales processes to drive focus and efficient pitching and closing as well as improving conversions, monitoring sales cycles, and maximizing wins
•	Interpreting analytics and research to support the development of regional sales strategies
•	Interpreting and simplifying the communication of complex data sets to enable predictive analytics to drive strategy and actions
profile_positions.title: Director Sales Operations EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for managing Wiley's Knowledge & Learning Sales Team across Continental Europe. The sales team comprises 7 representatives based in Copenhagen, Warsaw, Madrid, Istanbul, Amsterdam and the UK. The sales team manages all countries on the continent excluding German-speaking markets, but including Turkey, Israel and Central Asia. We represent all Wiley's book-related offerings. Our customers are found in both the Education, Consumer, Library and Reseller channels, reflecting the product mix of student textbooks; consumer books; reference works; digital services; and content for libraries, corporations and institutional customers.

A key focus is the development of relationships with partners for increased distribution and delivery of digital and customized content. Our mission is to support the learning and development life-cycle from basic skills through higher education to post-education and continued career growth and certification.

Core responsibilities include:

• Responsible for a budget of several million USD covering all content and services in the region
• Direct reporting lines of seven Account Managers and Sales Support team members
• Responsibility to report directly to the EMEA Sales Vice President
• Strategy development for the entire region including forecasting and budgeting for fiscal sales cycles
• Overseeing and approving licensing and contract negotiation
• Coordinating a Market Research and Analysis strategy for successful deployment of regional strategies
• Directing the regional deployment and optimal use of CRM systems
• Representation at key international events entailing dialogue with government representatives
• Support of sales staff in negotiations with key accounts and (re)negotiation of contract terms
• On-going industry analysis and identification of prime sales opportunities
• Coordination with the range of Senior Marketing Managers to develop optimum strategies for the region

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the sales of Higher Education product in Continental Europe. The core territory included markets in the following countries: The Netherlands, Belgium, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Iceland, Germany, Austria and Switzerland. In addition, the geography encompassed the entirety of Eastern and Southern Europe

I managed a team of sales representatives situated across the territory, reporting to me. My own reporting line was to the Higher Education Sales Director for EMEA.

The product promoted and sold comprised primarily textbooks for the Higher Education market. The portfolio also covered certification schools, as well as business schools and Distance Learning centres. As well as books, technology solutions for instructors and students were also a key component of the product-offering.
